title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: During the pandemic, the interview process was through zoom and the individual being interviewed was interviewed by two members of the housing staff at the same time and they asked questions about skills and motivations related to the position.
Interview Questions: How do you think you could help to benefit the community?

title: Web Designer/Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about 2-3 months after applying. They had a welcoming group styled zoom interview with very thought provoking questions. Took about a month or so with mindfully gapped process inquiries to find out the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Not too bad at all! No trick questions, interviewers were responsive and attentive. I was worried going into it, but you need not worry if you find yourself in the same shoes. At least for this program.
Interview Questions: How do you work on a team?

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Got an email for a select interview, then a Zoom interview next, 10 to 20 minutes for that meeting, with a group of people, with their team members, and haven't received their decision yet.
Interview Questions: What are some of the most important qualities that a student services coordinator should have?

title: Electrical Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: The five guys who interviewed me made the process light and fun. The questions they asked were easy to answer and they gave a bunch of time for questions and for you to answer the questions they asked you.
Interview Questions: What are some tools you've used

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. I was interviewed by a panel of department members. While they did ask some standard questions, the overall interview flowed more like a conversation about what they are doing, what they want, and what skills I have.
Interview Questions: What is your availability? Do you have experience in this field?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. It was a completely virtual interview with a panel of workers from the department that I was interviewing for. They asked me a lot of questions and unfortunately I can’t remember all of them. But they were essentially asking me about my experience as it relates to what was in the job posting. It was a little awkward because they ask a question, I answer, and then they take a moment to write my answer down, so the silence made me a feel a bit nervous. However they were incredibly kind people. I have interviewed for a few state jobs and this was the one I felt most confident about, and most comfortable with.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student came to you asking for resources?

title: Multimedia Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions:
Had one panel interview, everyone was on topic, questions were appropriate, and overall a very healthy culture. The environment was professional and it took covid precautions seriously.
The interview was thorough yet didn't take much time
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Multiple Rounds of straightforward questions to relate past experience to current role.  Everyone was super friendly. The process did take two months, which was longer than other comparable institutions with similar positions.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict?

title: Vet Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Meet & Greet with lots of descriptions on the hospital itself and the many positions it offers. It was very lively and the conversation carried very nicely. I spoke to a coordinator who then sent me two positions I would be the best fit for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you want to work here.

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included two steps, first one is a phone call screening and it was followed by a zoom interview with 4 interviewers. The background check takes two weeks at least.
Interview Questions: What is your salary expectation?

title: Professional School Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions:
Easy to talk to staff.
Conversation flowed
Panel interview.
Rotation questions.
The interview process was average, a lot of questions and was informative staff on panel displayed excellent listening skills and though some questions were a bit challenging I was able to pull through and remain focus.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time you had to work through a challenging time ?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: The first round was a phone interview and from there, I was asked to do a final interview. The final interview (virtual) was a little more than 2 hours with breaks in between. I met with the academic department of the respective college for a formal interview before heading into a presentation with the academic and student services department, members of the alumni foundation and faculty. Lastly, I met with the person that would be my direct supervisor for a 1:1 interview. The presentation prompt and time requirement was given to me in advance. The timing from initial interview to offer was right under a month. Overall, it was a great interview experience and similar to other higher ed interviews I have had in terms of questions asked and presentation.
Interview Questions: How have you adjusted to recruiting during the pandemic?

title: Working Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was short and sweet. Had to show some work of my own and talk about the process. Also asked what I had planned for my future. They talked about what happened in the major and all the types of projects we would be doing
Interview Questions: What did I know about the company

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a virtual interview that consisted of general questions for about 30 min. I was a but surprised by the way one of the interviewers phrased a question.. It was borderline trying to get my age. Overall an ok experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging moment while advising a student?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process was very casual, only fair questions were asked.  Many of the questions were centered around teamwork or working on a team. There was only one curveball question at the end.
Interview Questions: What is one time you thought outside the box?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward 1 on 1 interview where we went through my resume and spoke further about the job requirements. At the end of the interview I was told if I was accepted of did not get the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have enough time for this job?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: there were around 4 interviewers, and each asked questions in turn. some of the interviewers were friendlier than others, but none were too hostile. overall the experience was not too bad.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a diverse student body?

title: County Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, Zoom call, interview with county and district directors, sometimes state directors too. Give a presentation on how you would develop a county program. Some interviews would involve community members to sit in and ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: How would you develop the county program?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Depending on which department/division you're applying for, the process can be different in minor ways. After submitting my application and from the closing time, I received an email fairly quickly to schedule an interview. The interview itself was with a committee and the supervisor right afterwards. There was only one day of interview.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the specific question, but they ask about how you would handle certain cases and scenarios?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: This began with an introductory phone Interview. Multiple employees on call with 20 minutes to answer 8-10 questions. Very formal interview with not much opportunity to get to know you personally.
Interview Questions: EDI Questions; Why NCSU; Very Specific program questions

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: it is a very good and calm and direct interview process. I think they are very good about interviewing for their positions. highly recommend the position. i like it a lot
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself and a time you succeeded

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: via phone - screening process. Did not have all of the experience that they wanted. They wanted to have someone with higher education experience. Would definitely apply to other opportunities at NCSU,
Interview Questions: How can your past experience help us?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively simple and straightforward. They asked about my past experience, as well as what I would desire out of this position. Also went over my resume
Interview Questions: What is your past experience in this role or a similar role?

title: Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: It was good and focused on things mentioned on the resume along with statistics questions. Leadership and teamwork skills are expected. The interview was for 40 mins and went smooth
Interview Questions: Whats ARIMA? Whats P value in Hypothesis testing?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, engaging, and with multiple small groups of people. Also included lunch with the managing supervisor. Afterward, a coffee with the entire team was part of an informal second interview.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength

title: Donor Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Screening call, Zoom interview with director + then with a hiring panel, project assigned, two more one hour interviews (one with director and assistant director, and another with the hiring panel).
Interview Questions: What drew you to NCSU?

title: Business Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Email received requesting a phone interview. Phone call interview set up for following week.  After phone interview an  in person interview was scheduled shortly there after. blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah
Interview Questions: Describe your previous position

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a very informal call with the head of the program I was applying for. It was an exchange of a few emails and then a 10 -20 minute phone call.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying to this program?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was over Zoom, the interviewer was nice and easy to talk to. She smiled and made me feel welcome and shared what she needed from the candidate coming in.
Interview Questions: Could you describe your strengths?

title: MS Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: there is an optional tour, given by the head of admissions. the interview was comprised of one staff, one faculty, two former students, one which graduated recently and one which graduated later. the interview committee will be relatively straightforward with you about what they think their primary reservations about you as a candidate are. be prepared to answer these.
Interview Questions: tell us about a time you had a conflict with a team member.

title: Bookstore Department Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The staff was very nice and welcoming. It was helpful in understanding what the specific duties of the job would be. They took the time to get to know their potential future employee.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Insightful and straight to the point. I was asked questions about past experiences and why I was interested in the role. I suggest following up with whoever you interviewed at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: What do I bring to the table? (Skills and experiences) What am I most excited about in the role?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Well done, thorough
If you’re interviewing for a domain-specific role, expect the questions to center around the specific technology or programming language you specialize in, such as JavaScript, C programming, or React. These highly-technical interviews may also involve a take-home test that requires you to debug or build something.
Interview Questions: What programming languages do you use? Which three do you prefer or are most familiar with?

title: SAS Building IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: You applied online and were almost guaranteed an interview slot. The people were friendly, polite, and professional. They also provided you with a list of questions that you should be prepared to answer. After your interview, you heard back within a week.
Interview Questions: A client calls with an issue you don't know the solution to. How do you handle it?

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: phone interview - asked me 5-6 questions and it was a very thorough phone interview. Although I did not get the job or asked in for an in person interview, they were very responsive and took the time to keep me in the loop on the interview process and status of the position.
Interview Questions: explain a time you dealt with an unexpected situation and how you handled it

title: Dining Room Server Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. Not a fan of casual interviews, but the processed seemed fair. Do it if you want  to, good for student who just want to earn money and get free food.
Interview Questions: Availability?

title: Service Center Manager - Campus Enterprises Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received called 5/14 to come in for a interview two days later. Interviewed with fourth people, hiring manager starts by telling me there is no right or wrong answer to the questions. I gave my answer to the first question, they seemed like it wasn’t good enough answer. Was asked around 20 questions but the questions had two/three questions inside of that question. At the end of the interview I asked why this position wasn’t listed as a university program manager (since I would be supervising someone) but only as an associate which would be less money but the same work, wasn’t any interest in properly paying me. Guess that explains why there is nearly 500 jobs open on there website.
Interview Questions: All questions related to job posting on the website.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful interview process. Two phone interviews and one in person interview with the entire team that I would be leading, then with my direct supervisor, and then a panel of three from across the university, then finally with the director of my department.
Interview Questions: How would I handle different situations that would come up.

title: Donor Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview with Director and Assistant Director, and then 30 minute panel interview with remainder of team (4 staff).  I brought writing samples, and we talked through the gift naming process.
Interview Questions: What challenges have you faced in the workplace and how did you overcome them.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fully informative. My interviewer described me about all the previous and current research process in their lab and all accomplishment that they gained in 10 years. He gave me a tour for their facilities. All my coworker were so warm and friendly.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were around my phd thesis and all my previous researches. All my experiences were be questioned.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Welcoming, friendly, and enjoyable atmosphere. Was shown around the office space and introduced to a few key employees. Interview was with the department head as well as two of the "right hand" employees. Took less than an hour, and was provided with very clear instructions on getting to the facility, parking, etc.
Interview Questions: Lots of situational questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with one of the post-docs. Very casual, followed by a tour of the labs. Some of the questions referred to my prior experience while others were questions about handling fast paced environments. Additional questions  about how I would handle conflict.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had to email my current supervisor my resume and provide 3 references. I was interviewed by my supervisor. She then also called my references to talk to them about me and if I would make a good candidate for the position.
Interview Questions: What makes you the most suitable for this position?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, hear back in 2-3 weeks, phone interview, face-to-face interview, offer 4 weeks later or you get ghosted. There will be no follow up to let you know if you got the job or not and why. My interview went well from what the folks in the interview said, but I never heard anything back despite trying to contact them. It doesn’t seem like an equal opportunity experience.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of questions regarding interpersonal skills.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Office Hall, VA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Process was very easy.  However, know something about the company.   You will be tested on the history of the company.  They will be impressed if you know the company's history.   Go to the website and other site.
Interview Questions: What school did you attend

title: Student IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fun and clean and very easy to get comfortable and the interview was easygoing. They asked mainly behavioral questions and then proposed some situations and see how i would react to that
Interview Questions: Q: Explain how you would deal with conflict?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a long drawn out (11 months) process from 1st phone interview to written offer. Interviews were by phone until the finalist interviews (on campus) with panels of interviewers. I appreciated the hiring manager’s transparency throughout the process, which was tough due to length and uncertainty. The interview questions themselves were always very fair and focused on measurable skills and outcomes suited to the position. I also had to complete several tasks related to the position I was interviewing for in a time-limited segment. That was intimidating but really helped me assess if I wanted the job (...and, I assume, let them know I wouldn’t be terrible in the job).
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you failed at a task and what you learned about yourself?

title: Community Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone and went by fairly quickly. I am not sure if this is still the case but it did not last longer than 10 minutes for me.
Interview Questions: What was a situation where you were faced with a challenge, and how did you overcome it?

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and transparent. I was interviewed by a team of accountants and grants managers, all of whom were kind and easy-going. They had my resume on hand and the interview was more of a conversation, discussing how my past experience would prove beneficial in the role I applied for.
Interview Questions: What is one thing about your current position that you do not like?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process went by very smoothly. The professor was very forward with what he expected and provided great detail one what was expected. Communicating is a big point for me and the professor was great at giving me updates throughout the process. We had a discussion about the class topic.
Interview Questions: What are you past experiences?

title: Helpdesk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fast and easy. They mainly want to know that you have the basics of IT support "Recall (or Lookup) knowledge, pass it on to the user" down! The interview focuses more on the customer help side of things than technical knowledge.
Interview Questions: Imagine a user asking you how to deal with (insert sample account issue here). How would you go about helping them?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process at NC State was fairly typical. It moved a bit faster than I have heard is typical.  I first submitted an online application. I was contacted to schedule a brief phne interview. After the phone interview, I was invited for on-campus interviews. During the on-campus interview, I met with a panel of six people from various positions within the department including the Dept. Head, the Operations Manager, faculty and other staff. The questions were typical behavioral-based questions.
Interview Questions: They asked about how I establish priorities and manage multiple tasks.

title: Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: It was ok, standard format, phone panel interview. It was ok, standard format, phone panel interview. It was ok, standard format, phone panel interview. It was ok, standard format, phone panel interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Waitress Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (New Lenox, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Super easy going they asked about me and my past jobs, overall basic questions. I was also asked how I would contribute to this company and my ability with customer service, my experience at other job titles I’ve had.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, and where I see myself in 5 years

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Difficult but do-able, didn't ask anything that felt overwhelming. Good questions and friendly people, if you're willing to put in the time its a good place to land. If you get the chance, I would recommend.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your past research

title: Agriculture Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Barco, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 2 persons that weren't qualified to make judgements about my academic skills. Process lasted at least 3 months and I was led on a goose chase. I called the office at least twice in 2 weeks and nobody in the office could answer my questions. I have less conviction in the extension's mission now than the poor opinion I had before. Interview did not play to my strengths, but I guess that's my fault. Jostled out of the job offer by a person working for a big box store and mowing lawns for a living. I received a letter from extension explaining my experience and education did not match their current needs. Apparently, knowing how to work a cash register gives you great people skills.  My supervisor-to-be left his job at the extension office shortly after the day of my interview. I must have missed a jolly job opportunity.
Interview Questions: A caller tells you their plant is dying and they want organic. What do you tell the person?

title: Temporary Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: I was just asked about my previous experiences. It was a very easy conversation. The interviewer asked about my past experiences and my hours available. She asked if I had experience working with people.
Interview Questions: What customer-service experience do you have?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: You apply online through one of roughly three portals and you hope for an interview. I apply through the curious website for research opportunities in the biological sciences majors. I applied for breast cancer research and biotech agricultural research projects.
Interview Questions: Do you have any wet lab experience?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, wait for them to email you. Or go directly to manager and ask. They don't ask questions, generally, and cut straight to the schedule. After that, you go to work in a couple of days and you're a part of their family. That's literally it.
Interview Questions: When can you work?

title: Senior Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3-4 rounds. Well thought out balance of personal and professional questions. Well thought out balance of personal and professional questions. Well thought out balance of personal and professional questions. Well thought out balance of personal and professional questions. Well thought out balance of personal and professional questions.
Interview Questions: Well thought out balance of personal and professional questions

title: Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interviews was through a phone call due to a snow storm that year. My interviewers were previous alumni of the program and they were fairly nice. The second round of interviews were group interviews in person.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer working in a forefront position or backend position and why?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: I met with three people - a professor, a research assistant, and an administrator, for about an hour. The position was an exciting one, but they also wanted the position to do a lot of different things and be extremely independent.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Front Desk Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: In person interview. Was asked a series of questions about knowledge of campus and scenario questions. Also talked about hours that could be worked and other time constraints. Asked what to do in an emergency, etc.
Interview Questions: How do you get from Talley to the Tri Towers

title: Licensing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: After 2 weeks of applying for the position, I was scheduled for first interview call (telephonic). There were 3-4 people from the team who took my interview. It was very focused on the responsibilities mentioned in the job description. Interviewers were knowledgeable and didn't ask any questions out of the topic, but to be honest it was intense. After 2 weeks from 1st round, I was scheduled for in-person interview. NCSU has made nice arrangements at good hotel and person from the team picked me for interview. I had full day interview with whole team i.e 4-5 interviews in a row. Later, I received call from the Director of the department to offer me job and get joining details. My interview experience with NCSU was excellent.
Interview Questions: What is bayh-dole act? Why you want to join tech-transfer? How you would approach inventor's and industry people?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job the last week of June.  I went on an interview in July.  It is now August and no one has reached out about whether or not I will be offered the position but at this point I seriously doubt it.  The main issue I have is that they pre-checked my references.  This is the first time that this has ever happened to me and it put me in a very awkward position with my current supervisor.   Then after my interview they re-advertised the job and didn't bother to let the people who'd been interviewed know that they were no longer under consideration.    I think the combination of  pre-checking my references  and then not having anyone reach out and just let me know I wasn't being considered any longer when the department re-advertised the position (after I'd interviewed) was unprofessional and rather inconsiderate.  I totally understand that you don't get an offer for everything that you interview for but lack of communication is unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Reference check question:  Where does she sit?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was good. i studied in the North Carolina State University for 2 years having a masters degree in electrical engineering with specialization in communication courses, networking courses and circuit design courses.
Interview Questions: not many questions

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I made it through two rounds of interviewing. The interviews involved 4+ staff members, with the second round being a couple of hours long. The people were nice and the questions asked and conversations that ensued were thoughtful. I reached out with a thank you email and received no response, which isn't a huge deal. After not hearing from them for a little over a week, I reached out to check in and received no response. I never heard back. After making it so far in the interview process and investing a considerate amount of time, I was disappointed to have been completely ghosted.
Interview Questions: They inquired about my experience cultivating and soliciting annual donors.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: No interview, I got TA position when I got accepted to the program. Beside GRE results, I had to submit motivation letter and resume. The letter showed why I am the perfect fit, how will I contribute from the program and how will the program contribute from me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: One interview with director over video. Questions regarding legal experience and interest in coastal issues. Offered job within a week of interview and accepted. Job was part time and allowed for remote work occasionally
Interview Questions: What is your interest in environmental law?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submit application with the course you are confident to teach/tutor marked and wait for messages from the course instructor. When you instructor review your background, he will have a face-to-face meeting with you to test your background knowledge for qualification.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the course material? Do you have any real experience?

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional, yet comfortable. Ithe flowed more as a conversation than an interview as we discussed research and career goals and what the specific position would mean in the terms of experience. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and the interviewer got back to me as quickly as possible. Overall, very professional.
Interview Questions: Do you plan on attending a PhD program in the future.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I just went through a normal in-person interview with my PI to figure out how we can be mutually beneficial to each other. We discussed how my background, which was completely different than the program I was applying into, can help me succeed in the current role.
Interview Questions: What is your long term goal?

title: Extension Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview focused on questions that were listed when I applied on the NCSU page.  I had my interview with lead investigator and two staff.  Interview involved a presentation and then follow-up questions.  It lasted a little over an hour.  I was given a job offer a month or so later.  It took quite a while to hear from them initially.
Interview Questions: Same questions as online when you apply.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Actually there is no interview for me. Someone refer me and the PI know me very well. Then we have a casual interview. Basically, this offer is based on the publication and the direction of the research.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about the research that you know about our group.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions:
Simple, questions were the expected ones. People was friendly and to the point. Good description of the job.

First interview was by phone followed by an in-person interview. The in person interview was on a panel format including all members of the program. Each of them had a chance to make a question.
Interview Questions: How are you going to match your experience with this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer started with basic questions, for eg courses taken in the semester. Then i was asked basic conceptual questions of electrical engineering, as basic as resistance, capacitance, magnetic and electrical fields concepts. I was asked to explain my past work projects and current study projects. Interview lasted 45 minutes and was an good overall experience for me.
Interview Questions: The questions was regarding one of the concepts on my final year bachelors projects. It was about magnetic field density concept question, which was perplexing and which I didn't expect.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was Ok, relaxing. It lasted for about an hour. There were several questions asked by the PI, and explanations about the ongoing project. After, I was offered the job, and the we discussed about a possible collaboration with other groups.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was very Quick process in the beginning after my initial in person interview there was a couple weeks lapse before I heard anything back regarding the position. I was then contacted for the position in which I accepted.
Interview Questions: How to handle Difficult Clients?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. I am simply writing this because I want to look at the reviews for other jobs on this site.  You start out making like 8.50 and if you do enough of the training hours and tutor for enough hours, then you can make more.  It tops out at around 11.50 or something like that.  I quit because it's not all that great and can be frustrating.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: fairly easy if you have the right background. I interviewed only with 1 person who would be my boss. They like to meet you to get a feel for who you are, other than that, if you have the right credentials it should be a breeze
Interview Questions: how can you contribute from day 1?

title: MBA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you have to take the GMAT. If you can, get it waved (check out the website for details) because it really speeds up the whole process. When filling out your application, make sure you carefully craft your essays, personal statements, and letter recommendations. These things really matter. Do your homework. After you submit the application, wait a month until they ask you to interview. It can be in person or online. It took 30 min. They asked 10 questions and allowed me to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your spare time?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: One full day interview with 45 min presentation and question hours, lunch and one on one meeting with all lab member . They describe what they are doing and i also present my work and some common question
Interview Questions: Why you join my lab

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a phone screening with 2 members of the search committee. Then there was an in-person interview. It was a full day interview that included meeting 6 groups of people - a total of 27 people. It was valuable to meet a lot of stakeholders and I was asked questions from a lot of perspectives.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What is your proudest accomplishment?
Describe a time when you had a conflict.
Why are you interested in this position?
Why are you interested in this organization?
How would you approach managing technologies with which you are not experienced?

title: Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Asking me the team work, and aptitude, and enthusiasm. And I heard back from them 4 days later. It was an easy going interview no pressure and they treat you well
Interview Questions: Why NCSU? why now?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: There is no formal interview, but you need to get good grades from the professor you want to work with. He/she will give you a small amount of work and expect you do that. You must be eager to learn about his/her research field and show that you will be available to work for long period of time (a few semesters or years). If you have already had a publication at the same or related field, it is a big plus. However, this all highly depends on the professor, how many students he/she has and his/her funding.
Interview Questions: How would you improve this algorithm? (his existing research work)

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was brief, quite casual actually. We were asked a few questions then about our extracurricular life, and a few things about my resume. When asking about my resume though they went into more detail that I thought, so be sure to buff up on any old knowledge of the things on your resume.
Interview Questions: Who inspires you the most in your life?

title: Resident Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process aren't too bad. The questions are basic and try to learn about your dealings with leadership in the residence halls. It seems to mainly serve to get you acquainted with interviews—most applicants get an interview regardless of how good their initial interviews were.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you showed leadership in your residence hall.

title: Student Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: You can apply through NC State or schedule an interview through email. After you reach the sit-down phase of the interview process, it is followed by meetings with other marketing professionals in the company.
Interview Questions: Do you have marketing experience?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a programming interview in CSS, HTML and python. I had to write code on paper. The test should be easy to everyone who is comfortable working with front end frameworks.
Interview Questions:
How would you modify the layout to look like this?
Basic questions in python and HTML

title: Purchasing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite pleasant. I was able to meet many people that I'd be interacting with on a normal basis. Interview and tour last around 3 hours long.
Interview Questions: Q: Are the the type of person that informs management before making a decision?

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Committee Panel for an administrative position which was really odd. Honestly, the interview could have been completed by one or two people. Be prepared to have multiple people staring you down when you answer your questions. Not very inviting.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with the position? What experience do you have with Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint? What do you know about the organization? What are the pros and cons of the position? Name a time when you got behind on a deadline? How do you keep organized? Name a time when you have had an interpersonal conflict?

title: International Admissions Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the International Admissions Evaluator role 30+ days prior to being contacted for an initial phone interview. During the phone interview, I was asked four questions and had an opportunity to ask questions. The interviewers were very nice. I was instructed that the next stage includes an on-site interview.
Interview Questions: Can you provide an example where you completed a detailed project?

title: Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with several department heads all were in the room together, all taking turns asking questions. Then there was a tour and I sat with a seasoned client service representative to get a feel of the position.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness of yours?

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview took about 30 minutes and they asked a fixed set of questions.  The hiring manager never looked me in the eye--she kept her head down focused on the questions the entire time--that was rather disconcerting.  The questions weren't difficult but I felt that it was a very poor interview process.  No one gave me any information on the hiring timeline and I recently emailed to follow-up--it's been two weeks and they said they'd make a decision within a week and no one responded to me.  On the website, it still has my application as "under review".  I understand that people are busy but a one or two line email either letting me know that they hired someone else or that the process is taking longer than expected would have been nice.  
Note: this is the 3rd or 4th interview I've been on at NCSU and I haven't had any offers.  I'm the first to admit that I'm not perfect but on two occasions they've hired someone younger with MUCH less experience than me.  I even called HR and they said they'd look into it and I never heard back from them.  That seems shady to me--I have been qualified for every job I've interviewed for and I know that my references were good.  I guess at NC State 40 year old's just can't compete with a woman in her 20's.  I realize that  I sound bitter but to be frank--I am.
Interview Questions: What types of accounting actions have you performed in the past?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. I had applied through my college career services. The company had come to our university for career fair. So it was college recruitment process.
Interview Questions: W\Explain your research experience?

title: Cater Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview. Applies online, got an email saying would like to have an on-site interview at Talley Student Center; arranged a meeting time in the morning; got there and leaded by the event coordinator to their office on the ground floor. Just a couple of standard questions and then got offer immediately.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience?

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It only took about 1 hr. It was a group interview, a total of six people were sitting there.  I was asked to introduce myself, to talk about my previous experience, to talk about my skills. They discussed some skills with me. not much behavior questions were asked. They did not ask too many question in details. The process was as expected, not very difficult, but finally they chose another candidate with more experience.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself in/after five years?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview and then brought in for on-campus interview. Both processes included the typical interview questions and demeanor. They expect you to understand the job description, disclose weaknesses, see if you'll bend rules, get a feel for where you see yourself and what your long-term career goals are, etc.
Interview Questions: Think of a time you were involved in a situation where your integrity was on the line, what was the situation and how did you handle it?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got connected to a professor through a grad student. Interview was brief and super informal. The professor asked a few technical question regarding Matlab and basic statistics. I guess for undergrad research they care much more about your motivation than  previous experience. Just make sure you get things straight early on about stipend and funding opportunities.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with Matlab?

title: Teaching Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the department head and two professors. The interview lasted about 30 minutes. Everyone was very cordial and professional.The interview consisted of questions and discussion surrounding my answers.
Interview Questions: How do I handle difficult questions posed by students?

title: International Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty good. They took me basically because of my enthusiasm for engaging in study abroad and research abroad opportunities. Also I had previous knowledge in web designing and photoshop. As I am a graduate student, all my classes are flexible and they thought I would be an ideal fit as I would be able to cope up with the requirements and considering my international experiences and research abroad grants, they might have thought that I would be the best fit for the job.
Interview Questions:
Do you know web designing?
Do you know to write a grant proposal?

title: Center Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application online for a position at NC State in Raleigh, NC. Received a request several weeks later for a Skype interview. Pleasant experience, no tricks. Did not hear back for several more weeks.
Interview Questions: Very straightforward, basic interview questions (ie. what is your interest in the position, what experiences relate to the work responsibilities)

title: Postdoctoral Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: They ask me give a talk about my research. I visit their group and talked with lab manager for ten minutes, then he showed me the work environment. I give them a presentation for one hour, and they ask me some questions. At last, the manager talked with me again and give me some advice.
Interview Questions: What are your advantages to meet this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a 1 on 1 interview with the supervisor I would be working under. There were a set of standard questions used in HR rounds but he made them specific to my resume. There were around 20 questions asked. There were 2-3 referrals asked which were contacted but i was given a preliminary offer even before the referral.
Interview Questions: What was an instance of leading/managing a group on a challenging project?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interested in the research the PI was doing so I went in and talked to him in his office. He showed me around the lab and asked if I wanted to be a part of the group.
Interview Questions: He asked me what my research interests were.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The professors asked about my previous experience.  Then he talked about what he is doing right now and his expectation for me. Didn't talked too much about my expertise.
Interview Questions: What have you done before

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is usually like any other educational institution where if you have the skill set, you will spend time working on the lab and the field. A presentation was required.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and supervisor.  Went over my resume and asked about 15 questions about myself, education and experience. Showed me around the facility and got an email for an offer about 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: What would you describe as a weakness?

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call if I could come in for an interview because I was out of town I suggest a Skype, FaceTime, or other video chat method. They worked with me, but because their wifi connection was not great it did end up being a phone interview. There were three people that was in on the call, all rotated questioning. Most of the question did come from the subject of "Name a time when..." or "What would you did if ____ was to occur?"
Interview Questions:
How do you manage multi tasking?
Are you good with deadline?
Explain situations from your last employer.
What is your five year plan?
What are your strengths and weakness?
How well do you work with other?
If you see someone slacking off what would you do?
They then asked you if you had any questions?

title: Editorial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Beware - backwards process. Hiring manager requested an interview with me; however, a background check and reference check had to be cleared first. I went in to fill out paperwork and speak with a general screening manager within the institution. After positive references and a cleared background check were complete, I never heard from them again. The screening manager said that the position was eventually filled. I never received an opportunity to meet with the hiring manager after all my personal information and references were tapped and stored in their database/filing system. The process was discouraging and a waste of time for not only myself, but my professional colleagues who dropped everything to deliver positive reviews with quick turnaround on my part. More over, it has been difficult to explain the negligence to my colleagues as they felt the position was a great fit.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions:
asking you about your reach experience, and talking about your research topic, to introduce your self.
you should know your thesis very well and at least have some teaching experience,
Interview Questions: that are all quite easy

title: Software License Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Found the job on ePack and applied. I was replied to via email and asked to do a small sample of work. They then told me they would like to invite me for an interview and I did so in the next few business days. The interview was with both managers of the department. They both asked questions and then told me they were interviewing one other person but would get back to me within the next day.
Interview Questions: Asked me about some of the stuff I put on my resume (mostly previous work experience & how it could be applied now), asked about current skills I have and about general work ethic

title: Doorman Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy for job to get and try but sucks when it comes to personality and explanation. Great place to work on a empty budget. I have to type 30 words here I wonder if this will be thirty shots
Interview Questions: How are your people skills.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Signed up for this option while applying for the program, and got selected for GTA as well. There was really no interview for this position, I guess it depended on my motivational letter I submitted as a part of application.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy and time consuming, was called for one interview which went well, but took a couple of weeks to schedule, was then called in for the second interview which also took weeks to schedule, the communication between candidates and the person they are interviewing can be very confusing, and honestly, very frustrating.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NC State?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted a few weeks later for an interview. Interview went well, mainly asked questions about previous experience and personality questions. Got the job on the spot after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: They ll try and get to know a person through coursework or through free research contribution. If its through course work show your A grades. If through, research contribution work as if you are getting paid.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience? Fields interested (There should be good overlap with what the professor is working on currently)

title: Temporary Mechanical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Meet the principle investigator of the Cost Effective Residential Rooftop PV system. List the task I am going to accomplish for this project. He asked me if I want to work for multitask or in a single team. I said multitask will be fine for me.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to do the structural design regarding the solar racking system?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Talk with your PI. Just the standard apply process. He may ask you about your background, your motivation for research, papers you have published. The experience you gained from the past research work, etc. Overall, you should be sure about your interest before choosing an advisor and research field, because you will stick with it for 5 years.
Interview Questions: Different for different areas. It is hard to provide any suggestions here.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions:
It is a short, straight-forward process. some of the questions are related to your tutoring experience, relationship with student athletes, ect..
They offered me the position  couple of days after my interview.
Interview Questions:
Explain to me something from Statistic class?
Do you have a friend or family who is a student athlete?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Supervisor directly interviewed and hired on the phone, but waited for about one month to get the final offer, I did not ask for relocation fee and was asked to come to the campus and sign on the offer letter with HR. The hire was easy but the Lab is too small and supervisor told me that how many presentations, seminars and papers he needs to publish to maintain his status...
Interview Questions: no difficult question

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easygoing but professional. I thoroughly enjoyed the process, a series of questions were asked to obtain qualifications and experience for the position.  The job description  was described  and I was asked about  understanding of all the responsibilities, skills, certification and knowledge required for the position and if I am able to accommodate the job’s location and hours.
Interview Questions: Are you capable of working with Microsoft Office Products?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: After you've been at the graduate school for one or two years and finished the qualification test, you would be considered as a teaching assistant for the undergraduate students. You have to first participate some workshops, seminars to learn the basic teaching techniques.
Interview Questions: When students ask something that has been bothering them, you should be able to come up with an answer at the moment. If it's inadequate, you will need to think it more afterwards, and get back to students with a full answer.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: My professor looked at my past experience, the grade I scored in his course and hired me. Getting a job as a GRA is too easy. Just need to be persistent.
Interview Questions: Do you think your good at solidworks?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I heard about the opportunity for a graduate research assistant position in an administrative office on campus through an announcement posted in a listserv. Emailed my materials and was contacted for an interview about two weeks later. Typical interview questions were asked and the interview took about an hour in total. Was offered the job just over a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: Name a time to you had to navigate an ethical dilemma?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Las Cruces, NM) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The PI gave me a call and we chatted a little bit. He asked some general questions about my expertise and experience. And he asked me what kind of question I have for him.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone call about my research interests and how those would inline with the department. Then I came in and had a tour of the campus and went to lunch with students.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in to research?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hiring is conducted on the basis of faculty recommendation. One has to contact the faculty, often physically visit, to ensure a recommendation is made. Once the recommendation is made, the department will process the recommendation and issue a contract at the very last minute - leaving you in sense of mystery
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Scientific Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The question asked was very simple. Most of them were related to core java.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview. Ask a lot of the basic questions. What makes you a leader? Why do you want to be a building manager? Met with several different people and they all had their interview questions. It was a very relaxed setting. The staff was nice.
Interview Questions: How will you balance this job and a full course load?

title: Adjutant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email of my date and time for an interview.  They followed up with a phone call three days before the interview. I feel they interviewed all the applicants.
Interview Questions: Think about an instance when you were given an assignment that you thought you would not be able to complete. How did you accomplish the assignment?

title: Gardener Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Too many questions
Interview Questions: How do you repair a tractor?

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied via email; got phone call to meet the team in person. Went in for interview, never heard back, not even a "nope." The questions were very stilted, the lead interviewer was stiff and unfriendly, the other team members seemed more relaxed.
Interview Questions: The questions were very canned and stuffy; nothing organic. It was an extremely weird interview. Asked things that led me to believe previous staff had issues. Like, "How would you handle an irate customer who is high up on the food chain?"

title: Newswriter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief and did not require much prior experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Mailing application
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Malvern, PA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview that lead to an onsite interview. Onsite interview was mostly technical but also behavioral. Intuitively I felt that there was a need that I matches the requirement.
Interview Questions: How do you go about designing a email account

title: Research Associate/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was many years ago but each step was clear.  Job responsibilities and duties were clearly outlined.  Salary was clear but not negotiable.  HR processes have changed over the years so I do not know how relevant my experience is to what current interviewees will experience.  For example, there were no background tests then as there are now.
Interview Questions: Surprisingly, there were none.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. You get assigned during orientation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University
Interview Descriptions: Since it is a part time job, there is only one on site interview.
Interview Questions: Difference between the JSON and XML

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very basic interview with questions about work ethic, experience, and career interests. Interview took a total of 30 minutes. Took a tour of the office area and research lab. At the end, I was able to ask questions and give a thank you card to the person who interviewed me. I must have left a good impression because I got the job the next day.
Interview Questions: Why are you pursuing biomedical research?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It will be basic Behavioral Interview
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I just walked in my professor's office and talked to him about my previous research and express my interest in joining his lab. He then said he will give me funding and showed me around the lab. He is easy going person but pushes a lot in research. He requires that I need to finish 3 publications during my PhD here. And I got only part RA part TA position.
Interview Questions: my previous research, my thesis

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: They had a very quick response to application. Typical interview questions and very friendly interviewer. The questions felt fair and the interviewer very quickly indicated whether they were intent on hiring you.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to deal with a difficult coworker?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Day-long interview with PI and collaborators. I visited the lab, went to lunch with other lab members, attended lab meeting, attended presentations from current graduate students in the department, and met with current graduate students.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience.

title: Veterinary Technician Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed up by an in person interview. Explained how everything would work, and wanted to make sure I was a good fit. Maintained contact up until I started my internship, and met on a weekly basis to ensure everything was going well.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose NCSU CVM?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: as a student, there is no interview, but a self introduction, and the introduction of the whole department. The department head introduced the department courses. Student representative showed us the department events. the meeting was pretty short, about only one hour long
Interview Questions: why do you choose NCSU
