title: Postdoctoral Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, I sent an e mail to the supervisor whether he was looking for a Postdoctoral Research Scholar or not. He was positive, asked for a couple of recommendation letters, I got them sent to him and I made a presentation over skype and I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three days before the interview I sent an email to my professor, expressing my interest in his research and introducing my background. Two days later, the professor responded to me and asked me to go to his office to talk. I talked to him. He showed me around his lab, asked me some questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in FPGA?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had already secured the interview after a conversation with the director of the Center for Urban affairs and Community Services. She urged me to apply for the job. I thought about it for several days, then I applied through the universities website. I interviewed with the person who was to be my direct supervisor and another department supervisor in person. There was no phone interview. Then I spoke briefly with the director of the center.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was a proficient editor.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Resume is selected and graded from over one hundred applicants. You are selected for a phone interview that is conducted via a search committee. If selected to interview, the process is a day long process that includes an interview by the committee, one-on-one interviews with stakeholders, and group presentation on a preselected topic.
Interview Questions: Are you a cat or a dog person? This was an actual question.

title: Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
212 applicants on-line.
2 Separate interviews culminating with 2 final candidates. I enjoyed the process and felt as though I learned a lot about the culture of the department which was, when I was first hired, amazing. I accepted the job and was extremely happy for the first year and a half.
Interview Questions: How I could assist the department with continuing to provide stellar events with a smaller budget.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Questions: Interests, previous experience, Resume review, About the subject, Technical round,
Interview Questions: Thesis or Project?

title: Technology Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I became aware of this position on the Windows highered email list.  First interview was via Skype, and lasted around 2 hours.  It was a held by a panel of technology stakeholders.

Main interview was pretty much all day, meeting with technology teams from around the University - typical higher education interview for a enterprise technology role.  All aspects were covered - technology skills, communication skills, conflict resolution, etc.
Interview Questions: My favorite was "describe your general work demeanor".

title: Temporary Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I first met with someone in the Human Resources department. The interview process included basic questions regarding past employment, along with a test of skills of Microsoft Word and Excel. Once the background check was complete, they called to set me up with an interview in one of the departments on campus. I went to that interview and met with the person in charge of hiring for that department. The interview went well, and I got the job.
Interview Questions: Describe your role in a past position, including tasks, technical skills, and interaction with management.

title: CAC Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 Interview. Very positive experience. Friendly People. University is a great place to work as a student and always very fair in scheduling your time. Very fair. Working with the students and being interviewed by them definitely constitutes a highlight.
Interview Questions: Previous Customer Service Experience?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Two phone interviews were taken back to back with 15 minutes break , each of 45 minutes. In the first interview the interviewer asked me about my projects then he talked about the storage and filesystems and finally a coding question. In the second interview I was asked about concepts of OOP, basic questions on operating systems and networks, a coding question and finally a Object oriented design question. 
Gave my interview on Monday and received an offer on friday.
Interview Questions: Nothing was unexpected as such, they asked me about OOD of hotel reservation system.

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: First, few tech questions in theory are asked; it's like a professional background check; the questions are basic but a little bit hard. Then, ask experience in details, mainly on research interest and courses taken. Finally, a small test, which is more like a quiz. The decision of hiring is made very quickly.
Interview Questions: What's the main courses you took?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very straight-forward.  Asked about experience, career goals, research desires, work ethic, teamwork skills, etc.  No one grilled me on any topics.  Pretty easy process.  And had quick return offer.  The entire process took MAYBE 2 weeks.  Overall pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What are you career goals?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was process was well thought out. A lot of thought was put into the interview process. Basic questions asked that would meet job descriptions. Not stressful. Good environment. Fast turnaround time in all facets of the interview process. Interview was very professional. Gave candidate opportunity to ensure they were a good fit.
Interview Questions: Describe your work experience

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: This interview process began with submitting a CV, a coverletter, and additional writing about teaching and research goals. Chosen candidates received phone interviews to get more information not found in the application package. Candidates where then flown out for a one day interview with one-on-ones with department heads, college administration, a search committee, and presentations to students and to the departmental faculty. Meals were informal discussions with faculty and they shared about the excellent work environment at NCSU.
Interview Questions: What do you plant to do for the people of NC?

title: Information Technology Lab Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was incredibly quick and easy. The interview was done by the man who would later be your main supervisor. the environment was very casual and laid back. it was a group interview, but it was incredibly low key. The interviewer even brought coffee and doughnuts for everyone. there was about 10 people being interviewed. all were selected. training started the same day and continued on in the following days.
Interview Questions: Knowledge in technology applications, interpersonal skills, flexibility of schedule, etc.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: To be a qualified candidate, a solid academic background is necessary. Fully experience in coastal engineering is required, such as wave theory, model simulation, GIS techniques, and programming proficiency. In addition, sufficient project experience and publications will be helpful. At last, be prepared with some behavior questions and group collaborations.
Interview Questions: Give a gerenal understanding of all possible wave processes

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Position posted on NC State HR site.  Most positions conduct phone interviews and then follow-up with on-campus interviews.  Please note positions are left open after the suggested closing date, but that does not necessarily mean they are still accepting applications.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in leaving your current position?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I got the job through a friend. One conversation with the boss and I was hired. Very informal.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, by invitation and then application. Good to have a particular faculty contact that you have a relationship with and are interested in their work.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest and who do you want to work with?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied to Tox program in December and visited department in March. They had a recruitment dinner at Department Head's house. Selected current lab from 3 rotations.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Cullowhee, NC) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, 2nd Phone interview, On Site all day Interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interactive work culture.  Interview process is fair.
Interview Questions: Why don't you work in a company instead of a university

title: Fishing Survey Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Several months after I submitted the application, I received a call from HR of the Department of Land and Natural Resources. The interview was schedule for a few days later. Two days before I looked additional information on state fisheries regulations. The night before I reviewed the info. I also rehearsed potential questions they might have and how I would answer them such as "how do you think your previous experience will help you here?" The interview consisted three people in the panel and the HR rep. It lasted about an hour. The overall experience was neutral because one of the panel members kept saying that I am overqualified because I have a Ph.D. And a doctoral degree was not a job requirement.
Interview Questions: What is your strength? and weakness?

title: Administrative Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview to weed out,  one week later, group interview, same day 1:1 interview with direct supervisor, interviews with directors and assistant directors.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience where you had to work under pressure .

title: CA Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Ralls, TX) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: it was a very good interview.highly demanding and lots of tricky questions. It was very difficult.. It was very difficult and tough.. It was very difficult. It was very difficult. It was very difficult
Interview Questions: wat is your name

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: All day tour and one on one talk with professors. It was a great day.
Interview Questions: Every professor asked something a little different. None of them were gotcha's.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of a phone interview and a one page report on project goals.
Interview Questions: What was the X-Ray source used in the X-ray diffractrometer you used for your master's research?

title: Business and Technology Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at North Carolina State University (Raleigh, NC) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview and then on site interview. Phone interview was generic. Onsite interview was formal. Panel interview by the search committee.
Interview Questions: N/A
